title: Globalisation 101
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International Monetary Fund

abstract: Globalisation 101 looks at the impacts of corporate-lead globalisation on workers, indigenous people and the environment both locally and globally.
description: Globalisation 101 looks at the impacts of corporate-lead globalisation on workers, indigenous people and the environment both locally and globally. It traces the history of transnational organisations such as the World Bank and International Monetary Fund and charts the origins of third world debt.
